title: Boot from a hard drive not detected as bootable in bios ? Need help..

forumNotes.author: NyanNINI75
forumNotes.content: Hi ! OK so here the thing. I have a SONY 13,3' LAPTOP , and**two hard drives (2\* SSD)** , one is on the regular HDD slot \> we will call it main OS (1\* Samsung 840 256GB) and one is on the ODD-Bay slot \> we will call it secondary ssd (replaced dvd drive with caddy). I need to ***setup a dual boot for work***, and for some security reason (integrity of main system etc) , doing pentest on the second OS. The++BIOS++ *doesnt detect the secondary SSD in the ODD bay* , seem like a bios lock or a lack, but **the hard drive is detected without problem after one OS as boot (in windows i see it a secondary hard drive, can setup partition like i need to) and linux same.** After a lot of search arround, i have only find 2 way to boot on it 1 -/ Boot on the main OS (hard drive 1\*) with vmware/or virtualbox using physical hard drive option 2 -/ Create linux stick with vmware/virtualbox to boot it (same as 1/ but with usb stick, no vmware install on the main os) But i loose lot of performence by the way and GPU perf too (have geforce 640LE, usefull..) *So, can i made my second ssd bootable with VHD, or with a alternative boot manager ? (Like GRUB4DOS ..)* *for example, can i put one VHD with all i need on the ssd, then made a sample script (in a 4GB small usb stick) for launch the booting sequence and boot the VHD on the ssd ?* Thanks for any help ![:idea:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/idea.gif) !
